This species is capable of oxidizing hydrogen and can also grow using various organic compounds, such as glucose, fructose, and acetate, as sole carbon and energy sources. Cupriavidus pampae is also able to fix atmospheric nitrogen, which is an important trait for its potential use in agricultural applications.

Phylogenetically, Cupriavidus pampae is closely related to other species within the Cupriavidus genus, which are known for their diverse metabolic capabilities and their ability to thrive in a wide range of environmental conditions, including heavy metal-contaminated sites.

Further research on the ecology, physiology, and potential applications of Cupriavidus pampae may provide insights into its role in soil biogeochemical processes and its potential use in biotechnological or environmental remediation strategies.
